column4: Hello friends I need to upgrade to 9.10 from 9.04. But I'm not connected to internet and need to download updates from another computer..!
: download the iso and burn it like you would for a clean install, but just run it as an update package.
But I need to keep my customisations in jaunty
But in the upgrade notes they suggest me to apply all the updates for jaunty. How can I do that. I'm using internet from another computer with windows...?
in that case i'm not 100% sure how to do it. what exactly do you mean by customizations?
Like softwares I've installed, themes, Some files in home folder...
those will not be touched. running an update disc will only change core os files. your themes and installed programs will all still be there provided they are compatible.
But how can i update my jaunty...? Dist-upgrade should be after update as they say...!
updating will change it to intrepid. you are trying to move from 9.04 to 9.10 right?
interpid..????
I'm trying to move from 9.04 to 9.10
intrepid ibex is the name given to 9.10 the same as 9.04 was called jaunty jackalope
9.10 is karmic koala I think...Am I right...?
you're absolutely right i'm tired from both work and school today. i got confused
Whats your proffession..?
i'm a inbound customer service representative for time warner. new york division.
Ok so you can't help me...?
thats the way i have done it in the past.and it worked for me.
How can I download updates for a computer from another computer?
Are you busy...?
i went to the website and downloaded the iso for the next one up (9.04to9.10) not busy. slow typer.
